text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with how to make perfect instant
mashed potatoes that's right i'm doing
this video for three great reasons first
instant mashed potatoes are my official
culinary guilty pleasure and I've always
wanted to admit that in public secondly
these are almost never made using the
proper technique which I'm just about to
show you and then last but not least I
found out the company that makes my
favorite brand wanted to sponsor a video
which as you may know I almost never do
but I did agree because it is something
I enjoy and use for real and besides
this hairpiece is not gonna pay for
itself so with that let's go ahead and
begin with the star of the show our
Idahoan signature russets
oh yeah if you think any plain old
russets gonna make it into this think
again and I'm not gonna pretend to be
some kind of expert I mean I only took
one semester a potato in culinary school
but I do remember that Idaho grows the
best potatoes in the world because of
the perfect conditions we're talking hot
days cool nights and don't even get me
started on the volcanic soil but above
and beyond using the finest potatoes the
real key to making perfect instant
mashed potatoes is using the proper
technique and by proper technique I mean
read the back of the package I mean
think about it some very skilled very
talented people at Idahoan many of whom
I assume are wearing lab coats spent
countless hours coming up with the
perfect formula and as much as I'd like
to think I could approve upon that I
can't so we will definitely a measure
according to the directions and once
that set we can go ahead and carefully
pour our cold fresh water into a
saucepan along with our butter and then
we'll head to the stove and place that
over medium-high heat where we will
bring it up to a boil and besides
standing there and waiting for that to
happen
make sure you've grabbed a fork and that
your milk and potatoes are nearby
because as soon as this comes up to a
boil we're gonna take it off the heat
and quickly stir in those ingredients so
we will simply stand by with fork and
hand waiting for it to boil and by the
way we are just waiting for it to start
to boil alright once it starts boiling
don't leave it on the stove otherwise
that water is going to start to reduce
and throw off our perfect formula so
we'll just keep an eye on it and then
what we'll do as soon as that comes to a
boil is remove it from the heat and we
will pour in our cold milk followed by
our Idahoans signature russets
and then all we're gonna do is take a
fork and stir this in a circular motion
for 10 seconds and yes 10 seconds the
steering is all you need
don't worry if a little butter on the
edges now mixed in that's totally fine
and maybe an advantage so go ahead and
give that about a 10 second mix with our
fork and then we're gonna wait exactly
one minute for the magic to happen and I
mean that literally
both it's gonna be a minute and then
it's going to be magic so we're gonna
wait and let this sit for exactly 60
seconds at which point we're gonna take
our fork and give it another quick stir
for about 10 seconds and that is it if
everything's gone according to plan and
by plan I mean you measured and followed
the directions you should be enjoying
something remarkably similar to the ones
made in the traditional method and that
is exactly what I achieve right here
these should be buttery creamy light and
fluffy and nothing even close to the
dense gluey mess most people are forced
to endure so not to brag but I know bit
and then usually I would enjoy these
guilty pleasure style right out of the
pot but let me go ahead and plate some
up because we're gonna need a few
pictures plus I want to show off my
next-level potato mounting skills check
it out that's not bad and not that it
needs it but I'm gonna top with a little
thin slice of butter
mostly because I really love to watch it
slowly melt and then we'll finish up a
little bit of fresh chive and of course
toppings and fixings are up to you you
are after all the Johnny Cash of your
instant mash so while I do usually enjoy
these as is I did dress these up a
little bit for the photos but anyway
that's it our perfect instant mashed
potatoes are officially done and as I
dig in here I'm thinkin I called these a
guilty pleasure but truth be told for a
guilty pleasure I never really feel
guilty after eating them I mostly just
feel happy and satisfied so on behalf of
myself and my friends at Idahoan we
really do hope you give these a try soon
so head over to food wishes calm for all
the ingredient amounts which will be
coming right off the back of the package
and of course more information as usual
and as always enjoy
[Music]
